alert.note: Alert for Box Elder (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 10:49AM MDT until June 05 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Bear River At Corinne affecting Box Elder County. .Snow melt combined with reservoir releases will maintain high flows. Expect minor flooding downstream of the Cutler dam to continue. For the Bear River...including Corinne...elevated but decreasing river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. Flows will continue to decrease over the next several days, but remnant inundation of adjacent agricultural land will remain. * WHERE...Bear River At Corinne. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet (7897 cfs), Minor flooding will occur to agricultural land and associated roads adjacent to the Bear River near the Great Salt Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet (5730 CFS). - Forecast...The river is expected to oscillate around action stage for the next few days prior to receding further. Remnant inundation of adjacent agricultural land will continue for the next several days. - Action stage is 13.4 feet (5945 cfs). - Flood stage is 15.5 feet (7897 cfs). &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
